application_details.scheme_name: Cavalier House, 46 - 50 Uxbridge Road, Ealing - Cladding Remediation Scheme

decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the drawing title number(s): Location Plan, FRC5174-PL02 (Block Plan, Rev P1), FRC5174-PL03 (Existing Elevations, Rev P1), FRC5174-PL04 (Existing Western Elevations, Rev P1), FRC5174-PL05 (Existing Northern Elevations, Rev P1), FRC5174-PL06 (Existing Eastern Elevations, Rev P1), FRC5174-PL07 (Existing Southern Elevations, Rev P1), FRC5174-PL08 (Proposed Western Elevations, Rev P1), FRC5174-PL09 (proposed Northern Elevations, Rev P1), FRC5174-PL10 (Proposed Eastern Elevations, Rev P1), Design & Access Statement dated 26 April 2023, Fire Safety Statement dated 16 May 2023, Flood Risk Assessment dated May 2023,

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Prior to the replacement of cladding panels, spandrel panels, balcony decking and fascia panels, further details of the materials of these elements shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. These details shall confirm the materials and visual appearance of these changes and can either be confirmed through brochures or photos. Confirmation of the proposed materials would be required and once agreed, these materials shall be utilised.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Prior to commencement of the proposed work, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, demonstrating that the removal of existing cladding and installation of proposed cladding will not reduce the acoustic performance of the existing building, i.e. the replacement cladding is of equal or greater acoustic performance to the existing cladding panels. Details shall demonstrate that the replacement of cladding and associated fire safety work does not compromise standards of the Council's SPG10 and criteria of BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented accordingly and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D13 and D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),
- neighbour liaison, notifications to interested parties and considerate complaints procedure,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the work for the duration of the works in case of emergencies, enquiries or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D6, D14, SI 1, T3, T4 and T7 of the London Plan (2021).
description: Replacement of combustible materials with non-combustible cladding within the existing facades enclosing the residential units
